Not just Another Boca Raton Dentist

You'll discover some differences in between us as well as your typical dental practice. Almost certainly one of the most extraordinary difference is in Dentist's philosophy of ultra-conservative dentistry, or what is known as minimally invasive dentistry.

What this philosophy means is the fact that, despite getting educated in how to restore your teeth with fillings, crowns, bridges, implants, or what ever else, Dentist tries to not do any of that if it is at all feasible. A sealant to stop a cavity is better than a filling. A modest filling is greater than a bigger one particular. A filling is much better than the usual crown. Saving a tooth is far better than replacing it.

So Minimally Invasive Boca Raton Dentistry entails Dentist studying and continuously striving to perfect strategies that will enable him to create the the very least achievable alteration for your tooth. It's a higher regard for your tooth framework that nature gave you and a want to protect it as significantly as possible.

Press here to observe a video of Dentist describing his philosophy of dentistry.

An additional tenet of Dentist's minimally invasive dental philosophy is that he prides himself in making work that lasts as long as feasible. And he is a perfectionist in creating that excellent match, that ultra-smooth margin that doesn't attract plaque and recurrent decay, and in leaving the tooth as robust as possible when he's completed in order that his function lasts a life time. Root Canal Therapy

Root Canal in your future? If the root in one of your teeth became diseased in the days before Endodontics, you'd likely have to have it pulled. Modern dentistry has developed a dental procedure called root canal therapy. This specialization is called Endodontics, and Endodontics specialists are known as Endodontists.

At Rowen Dentistry we "cater to cowards". You won't feel any discomfort during the root canal procedure. We supply nitrous oxide sedation for all root canal procedures.

Root canals generally require more than one appointment. The tooth is drilled and the pulp is removed first, with antibiotics currently being used to stem infection, if warranted. After cleaning of the root canal and sealing for protection, a temporary filling is put in place to preserve out contamination until a permanent crown can be properly fitted. If needed, a metal or plastic rod can be installed into the root canal to offer structural strengthening for the crown.

Inside of every tooth is "pulp", which is soft tissue containing blood vessels, nerves and connective tissue. Pulp is found in a root canal that runs via the center of the "dentin", the hard tissue on the inside of the tooth. If pulp becomes diseased, the pulp tissue can die. If it isn't removed, the tooth will also become infected and it could be lost. Pulp extends from the pulp chamber down the root canal to the tip of the root in the jawbone. If the pulp dies, an abscess can form at the tip of the root and can affect the jawbone. Abscesses can cause damage to the bone around the teeth.

Mini Dental Implants

Do you have dentures? Are your dentures loose or do you have any discomfort? Do you have a crown or bridge that you simply would like to have in permanently? We have an easy solution..... mini dental implants

Mini Dental Implants
implant1 implant2

Mini implants are small diameter dental implants, meaning that the implants are less than 3 millimeters in diameter. Mini implants are for the most part less expensive than the price of regular dental implants, however depending on your case prices could vary. Another name for mini implants is SDI (small diameter implants). Mini implants are valuable for endentulous(missing teeth) patients that have lower or upper dentures that are loose or if the affected person wants an easy solution to hold the dentures in place. The 4 mini implants (on lower), or the 6 mini implants (on upper) consist of mini titanium implants that are placed into the bone and will act like the root of your tooth. There is an attachment incorporated into the base of your denture, referred to as being a locater. This attachment on your denture snaps onto the top (cap) of the mini implant. This will make the denture feel secure and in place within your mouth. Mini implants can also be used for fixed crown or bridge installations as nicely. Your smile is one of the first things people notice about you. If you are deciding on a cosmetic dentistry procedure, then you want to make sure that you choose the best cosmetic dentist possible.

A good cosmetic dentist will work with you in order to determine what goals you want to achieve, they will prescribe a treatment plan that will provide you with those goals, and they will provide you with financing possibilities so that your treatment is effective and affordable.

Cosmetic dentists like Dr. Kodish in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, make sure that their patients are informed and have input in every step of their dental treatment. "I want to provide my patients using the results they want," says Dr. Kodish, "and they can't get those results without being informed and having a say in their dental treatment."

A quality cosmetic dentist should not just be concerned together with the appearance of your teeth. They should be concerned about your overall oral health. Make sure that the cosmetic dentist you choose offers far more than just cosmetic procedures. A good cosmetic dentist should be able to provide you with an array of restorative, preventive, too as cosmetic services.

In addition to good communication and also the services they provide, a good cosmetic dentist will have plenty of experience and training. Learning about dentistry should never stop as soon because the dentist becomes certified; a good cosmetic dentist will attend clinics and workshops so that their skill advances in addition to the procedures they can perform.

Honesty is another quality that you should look for in a cosmetic dentist. A good cosmetic dentist will be honest with you about the procedure they can perform and what results they can provide you with. Always ask for references and before and after photos of the cosmetic dentist's patients. Many in the best cosmetic dentists have their own websites with ways to contact the dentist and before and after photos that you can view immediately.

Lastly, look at the office. By taking a tour in the facilities, you will be able to look in the equipment and technology that the cosmetic dentist uses. You will also be able to determine if the area is clean and professional, and you will be able to find out about the sterilization techniques the office uses.

A good cosmetic dentist will be able to provide you with a new smile. By making sure your cosmetic dentist is one that will be honest, communicate, and has experience, they can provide results that not only look good, but also work properly.

So one particular visit of about 90 minutes can give you dramatically whiter and brighter teeth.
Alternatively, your cosmetic dentist can have custom trays made for you, and give you an at-home kit with professional strength whitening gel. This produces an equally spectacular result, and it is done at your convenience over a period of 2 or 3 weeks.
Porcelain veneers
These are thin shells which your dentist can bond to the front surface of your teeth. They cover small defects such as:

In two visits, your smile is transformed. Porcelain veneers look and feel just like your natural teeth and is durable and stain-resistant.
Porcelain inlays and onlays

A porcelain inlay is really a type of filling that will not just replace decayed tooth tissue, but will be bonded to the tooth, so that it becomes a part with the tooth. It really is a great improvement on the old metal fillings, which were not bonded to the tooth, but just packed into the cavity. Inlays provide a strong chewing surface, are long-lasting, and never become loose. As well, the porcelain is chosen to match your natural teeth.

A porcelain onlay is like an extended inlay. When the tooth has decay or damage that extends beyond the cusps, or tips, with the tooth, down on to the outside surface, an onlay fills that space and provides a new outside surface for the tooth. As with inlays, it's bonded to the tooth. That means it provides a durable surface for chewing, as well as a tooth-like appearance, so that it's practically indistinguishable in the neighboring teeth.
Upgrade your metal fillings

In a single visit to your cosmetic dentist, you can have several, or all, of your metal fillings replaced with beautiful white porcelain fillings. When metal (amalgam) fillings become old, they tend to darken and loosen. They can make the entire tooth look dark, and can even fall out.
Porcelain fillings will be bonded to the tooth, and will never loosen or fall out. They'll look like your natural teeth, with the same lustrous shine.
A smile makeover
The biggest disadvantage of cosmetic dentistry is its heavy cost. Most people put off cosmetic dental surgery because it's so expensive. Though the price may differ in between metropolitan areas and dentists, on the whole it isn't cheap.

Even amongst cosmetic dentistry procedures with veneers and dental implants are one of the most expensive. Unfortunately, although veneers look very good and change the way you look, they aren't permanent, and can break or chip. This only means that you pay more to get the veneer fixed.

Although prices will vary all around, on an average, the following could be the cost of various procedures:

Dental implants - per tooth, $ 3000 - $4000
Teeth whitening - $600 - $2600 based on the procedure
Porcelain veneers - $600 - $1000 per veneer
Porcelain crowns - $800 - $1600 per crown

When paying so significantly for dental treatments, find out what the cost includes. He has a warm friendly and experienced staff, some of whom have been with him for practically 30 years.

Gum Disease Laser Treatment

Periodontal or gum disease happens when bacteria gets below the gum line and the attachment between the gum and tooth is lost. Three out of four Americans have some form of periodontal disease and only 3 out of 100 will ever get treated before its too late.

Gum disease is a silent, chronic, painless and communicable bacterial infection that often goes undetected or ignored until severe gum and bone destruction is unbearable and no longer capable to be ignored. Left untreated, gum disease can cause tooth loss and traditional remedy can hurt.

The latest conservative gum therapy uses a laser. The laser gently disinfects and evaporates diseased tissues from around the tooth and inside the gum pocket. This treatment interrupts the bacterial destruction of the tissues and bone, giving the gum pocket a chance to heal. Systematic repeated visits, generally 2-8, allow the gum pocket to be disease-free and sometimes allow tissues to reattach to the pocket to a normal or near-normal depth. This new laser treatment is gentle, less painful, and has a quick recovery. Whilst surgery might still be indicated for severely advanced periodontal cases, laser therapy is a a lot more conservative, effective and comfortable option for beginning to moderate periodontal cases.

Inside of every tooth is "pulp", which is soft tissue containing blood vessels, nerves and connective tissue. Pulp is found in a root canal that runs by way of the center of the "dentin", the hard tissue on the inside of the tooth. If pulp becomes diseased, the pulp tissue can die. If it isn't removed, the tooth will also become infected and it could be lost. Pulp extends from the pulp chamber down the root canal to the tip of the root in the jawbone. If the pulp dies, an abscess can form at the tip of the root and can affect the jawbone. Abscesses can cause damage to the bone around the teeth.

You can buy over-the-counter teeth-whitening products, and some people regard this as a cheaper alternative to professional teeth whitening. But our teeth whiten only while they're in contact with all the whitening gel. So whitening toothpaste is not an effective method, since we only brush our teeth for a few minutes each day.

Further, our teeth whiten according to the strength of the whitening gel. Over-the-counter gels have a lower concentration from the whitening agent (usually hydrogen peroxide), and are not as effective is professional-strength gels.

The Nite White at-home kit is easy to use. Your cosmetic dentist would first take an impression of your teeth, and make you a set of custom trays. The kit comes with 9 syringes of gel, each syringe marked to indicate how considerably gel to use each time. You simply squeeze the right little amount into the trays and wear them for 1 to 2 hours.

· If you prefer, you can wear them overnight. The gel won't over-treat your teeth overnight because it stops working after a couple of hours. But if your daily routine doesn't allow for wearing the trays, overnight can be a good option.

· The trays are not obvious. Most people won't notice that you have them in.

Teeth whitening
This can be done in 1 visit to your cosmetic dentist, or at residence over a period of 2 or 3 weeks. There are many teeth-whitening products available over the counter, but none will work at the same time as a custom in-office procedure.
Our teeth whiten according to how long they're in contact with the tooth-whitening agent. That process can be greatly speeded up by use of a dental laser. So 1 visit of about 90 minutes can give you dramatically whiter and brighter teeth.
Alternatively, your cosmetic dentist can have custom trays made for you, and give you an at-home kit with professional strength whitening gel. This produces an equally remarkable result, and it really is done at your convenience over a period of 2 or 3 weeks.

You can buy over-the-counter teeth-whitening products, and some people regard this as a cheaper alternative to professional teeth whitening. Further, our teeth whiten according to the strength from the whitening gel. Over-the-counter gels have a lower concentration with the whitening agent (usually hydrogen peroxide), and are not as effective is professional-strength gels.

The Nite White at-home kit is easy to use. Your cosmetic dentist would first take an impression of your teeth, and make you a set of custom trays. You simply squeeze the right little amount into the trays and wear them for one to 2 hours.

Teeth whitening
This might be done in one visit to your cosmetic dentist, or at property over a period of 2 or 3 weeks. There are many teeth-whitening products available over the counter, but none will work also as a custom in-office procedure.

Porcelain veneers
These are thin shells which your dentist can bond to the front surface of your teeth. They cover small defects such as:

In two visits, your smile is transformed. Porcelain veneers look and feel just like your natural teeth and is durable and stain-resistant.
Porcelain inlays and onlays

A porcelain inlay is really a type of filling that will not just replace decayed tooth tissue, but will be bonded to the tooth, so that it becomes a part in the tooth. It really is a great improvement on the old metal fillings, which were not bonded to the tooth, but just packed into the cavity. Inlays provide a strong chewing surface, are long-lasting, and never become loose. As well, the porcelain is chosen to match your natural teeth.

A porcelain onlay is like an extended inlay. When the tooth has decay or damage that extends beyond the cusps, or tips, from the tooth, down on to the outside surface, an onlay fills that space and provides a new outside surface for the tooth. As with inlays, it's bonded to the tooth. That means it provides a durable surface for chewing, also as a tooth-like appearance, so that it really is just about indistinguishable in the neighboring teeth.
Upgrade your metal fillings

In 1 visit to your cosmetic dentist, you can have several, or all, of your metal fillings replaced with beautiful white porcelain fillings. When metal (amalgam) fillings become old, they tend to darken and loosen. They can make the entire tooth look dark, and can even fall out.
Porcelain fillings will be bonded to the tooth, and will never loosen or fall out. They'll look like your natural teeth, with the same lustrous shine.

The biggest disadvantage of cosmetic dentistry is its heavy cost. Most people put off cosmetic dental surgery because it's so expensive. Though the price may differ in between cities and dentists, on the whole it isn't cheap.

Even among cosmetic dentistry procedures with veneers and dental implants are essentially the most expensive. Unfortunately, although veneers look very good and change the way you look, they aren't permanent, and can break or chip. This only means that you pay far more to get the veneer fixed.

Although prices will vary about, on an average, the following could be the cost of various procedures:

Dental implants - per tooth, $ 3000 - $4000
Teeth whitening - $600 - $2600 based on the procedure
Porcelain veneers - $600 - $1000 per veneer
Porcelain crowns - $800 - $1600 per crown

When paying so a lot for dental treatments, find out what the cost includes. A whole lot of clinics include aftercare during the cost of the procedure.
